attributes.action: Allow Religious Organisations to decide for themselves if they wish to offer 'religious' Civil Partnerships
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government seems to be assuming all religious bodies wish to stop Gay people from having religious partnership ceremonies.

Why not let the church denominations and other groups themselves decide rather than applying a blanket ban on religious content in Partnership ceremonies or from them to be conducted in places of worship.

Why for example are churches and others that are welcoming and accepting of Gay couples being denied to act in accordance with there religious interpretation and wish?
